intro: Anagallis capensis, commonly known as the common waterpourer, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bright pink to red flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks. Its flowers are typically borne on slender stems and bloom from late winter to early summer. Anagallis capensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
